snippet: Mr. Turnbull is a moderate Liberal, whose views, most recently on the legitimacy of same-sex marriage, had conflicted with those of his prime minister.
abstract: Australian Liberal Party member Malcolm Turnbull’s challenge to Prime Min Tony Abbott’s leadership results in party vote that elects Turnbull new prime minister, 54-44; vote is affirmation that party favors moderate Turnbull over conservative Abbott, who has been derided for not supporting gay marriage and other issues.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Turnbull is a moderate Liberal, whose views, most recently on the legitimacy of same-sex marriage, had conflicted with those of his prime minister.

headline.main: Malcolm Turnbull Defeats Tony Abbott to Become Prime Minister of Australia
headline.print_headline: Premier Falls in Australia After Revolt in His Party
